scenarioDescription:
The K2-137 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-137 is a star with 0.46 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.44 times its radius. It is located 322.49 light years away from the solar system.

K2-137 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-137 system


K2-137 b

K2-137 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-137 b is 159.000 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-137 b is 0.890 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, K2-137 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system K2-137, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-137 - Exoplanet Around a Main Sequence Star With the Shortest Orbital Period
